Message: Team, We are frequently facing the below issue in both the np1 and np2 Environments, there are more people are using the np1 and np2, "Process Files async exception: 'NoneType' object is not iterable" "Map Records async exception: 'NoneType' object is not iterable" There are file read issue also we are facing, we need to look this issue as priority, the latest image already we deployed into Production

Hi Sudeep, As discussed We are facing Inconsistent display issue While accessing the Organisations, For example When I click on Datalocker Org it displays All the repose which is belongs to Bankstatement Org, we are facing this issue inconsistently, and also attached the Response and request for your reference Also Please give more details about Fixed issue where having SITE_SETTING_ONLY_SITE_ADMIN_CAN_EDIT_ORG set could, under specific circumstances, cause users to not be able to view organizations they were a member of.

Hi Gopu We are discussing the UI issue internally to look into this further. Regarding the file service errors below, those are unrelated to UI issue that you previously mentioned. Can you share the logs for these errors?

Hi Gopu, Also, to follow up on this bit: Also Please give more details about Fixed issue where having SITE_SETTING_ONLY_SITE_ADMIN_CAN_EDIT_ORG set could, under specific circumstances, cause users to not be able to view organizations they were a member of. That bug is only exploitable under very specific circumstance and is highly unlikely to happen, especially when using SAML or LDAP. Assuming use of build-in Instabase authentication (not your internal IDP) this sequence of events would have to happen: 02/03/2020 Instabase Mail - RE: UI Issue in Latest Image https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ik=6093cacbd3&view=pt&search=all&permthid=thread-f%3A1658781864498786847&simpl=msg-f%3A1658781864498786847&simpl=msg-f%3A1659753312678437252&simpl=msg-f%3A1659776… 6/15 Add a user as an administrator to an organization That user creates a new team That user gets removed from the organization (directly) but retains membership via the team We are not aware of any customers that have experienced this error

Hello Gopu, We believe there may be an issue with the redis cache being corrupted. You can reset that cache by deleting the redis pod and letting it be recreated. If that does fix the issue, please let us know. If it does not fix the issue, the next step would be to retrieve the logs from the account-service, webapp and api-server pods and send them to us for review.
John, Frequently we are getting this issue now, what we can do in our side to fix this kind of issu... Please advice
Hi John, Just checking if things are under control on this thread. Please let me know if you need any assistance
Hello Gopu, Following up on this ticket - did you have any success with clearing the redis cache by deleting the pod? Please let me know if there is anything else we can do to help.
Just curious, was clearing redis the fix?
I just bumped the ticket today to ask them - they went radio silent after my request for them to delete redis and/or send us logs last Wednesday.
Hi David, After deleting the pods looks fine ..., but this same issue raised after few days

SC team reached me today and mentioned this issue is happening more frequently nowadays (twice a day) and they have to clear the cache to resolve it. They are not happy in clearing the cache. Can you please help to suggest a permanent solution?

I was talking to Sudeep, and he mentioned that he was going to get a video of this happening for us to look at. Not sure if he managed to do that. After the issue happens, does it go away when they refresh the screen again? Does it happen on just one random page load? If so, clearing the redis cache isn't actually the fix/problem. If it were cache corruption, I think it would stay wrong. I've tried to reproduce this on instabase.com (refreshing for many many minutes) and I can't get it to reproduce. I don't have any ideas, but I can try to take a look when I get into the office today and get my hands on an SC laptop.

As we do not have SC laptops in Blr, I tried this out with a couple of SC people at our office and could not get this to replicate. Gopu has also been in workshops and I believe should be available tomorrow, so we can replicate and record it if this replicates. From last time when we tried this over zoom - - does it go away after refreshing screen - yes - does it happen on just one random page load - yes

I did not have a chance to try this out on their laptop today. As a next step forward so that we can make progress (and not be blocked on someone going into the SF office), in addition to the video, it would be great if we could also get the logs for the services we mentioned before: account-service, webapp and api-server.
Thanks, heymian. Can you ask or help Gopu for those logs when you touch base with him Sudeep? He never replied to David’s requests for them last week and earlier this week.

Sudeep, another idea for debugging if you (or whoever) gets to look at their cluster. Can you confirm that all their services are properly pushed, especially the three that I asked for logs on. Maybe we have one rogue/outdated pod lying around and any request that's getting routed to that one is causing problems.

Gopu and I caught up, and he is not able to reproduce this issue atm, and he believes that its because of purging the cache daily. I will ask him to stop doing this temporarily to allow reproducing the problem. David, you can use remote control over zoom on SC laptop to replicate this (we do the same here for the lack of laptop around). In case you are able to replicate this can you also loop in Heymian on identifying root cause as she has the most context on the related services. The credentials for accessing logs on openshift are on 1 pass. Heymian, hopefully this works for you all. I do not think this problem will replicate in our prod infra structure as it does not look deterministic and seems to occur only at SC.
